title: Clinical Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Spartanburg Regional Healthcare System
Interview Descriptions: The interviewing process consisted of a phone screen and in person interview with the department head and her direct report. It was short and I heard back within minutes of leaving the parking lot.
Interview Questions: Situational questions "tell me a time when" or "how would you handle a situation with

title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Spartanburg Regional Healthcare System (Spartanburg, SC)
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview questions.. interview went well never been in interview where i was in there talking over an hour.. very nice nurse manager was very engaged. Loved the work environment and wanted to start on the med surg floor
Interview Questions: What made me want to become a nurse?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Spartanburg Regional Healthcare System
Interview Descriptions: This review is for the Mary Black campus. Met HR rep at college job fair.  Learned about open positions and hospital. New grads encouraged to apply.  Applied online. Interviewed with unit manager in person. Met other staff. Toured dept. Once licensed offer made.
Interview Questions: What made you want to  become a nurse? Strengths/weaknesses. Flexibility in schedule. How do you handle challenges?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Spartanburg Regional Healthcare System (Spartanburg, SC) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process as thorough and efficient and all aspects were described up front. The recruiter and the unit manager worked closely together with open and effective communication. They worked with my schedule and needs.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult situation and how it was handled by you.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Spartanburg Regional Healthcare System
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews. A call back between the two. Interview with nurse manager and charge nurse. Interviews did not last long. Met other employees and staff. Took a tour of the hospital.
Interview Questions: Why was I interested in working there

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Spartanburg Regional Healthcare System
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my online application. A few days other, I received a voicemail, asking me to call one of the HR reps. I attempted to do this several times, but the voicemail was full. I emailed the HR rep through the address stated in her voicemail message. Never received a response or call back. Not impressed, and I doubt I’ll be seeking employment with them in the future.
Interview Questions: None. See issue in interview section.

title: RN Level II Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Spartanburg Regional Healthcare System
Interview Descriptions: Awesome interview process ... very detailed and courteous . Interviewer made  me feel at home during the entire process. I felt comfortable not nervous and most of all everything was discussed with transparency.
Interview Questions: What are some of your goals and intentions for the future ?

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Spartanburg Regional Healthcare System
Interview Descriptions:
1st interview - in person - ask typical HR interview questions

2nd interview - peer interview - meet with different members of the team, and able to get more insight on the job, culture, and management.
Interview Questions: What are your interest in this role?

title: Specialist - Interpreter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Spartanburg Regional Healthcare System in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: they called me for an interview about two weeks after I apply, the interview was dec 2 at 2 pm, the people was so king and nice but I have to pay for my interpreter test in order to work in this place
Interview Questions: how many years of experience did you get like an interpreter?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Spartanburg Regional Healthcare System
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was amazing. Well organized and the company was quick to decide so I wasn’t kept waiting for long at all. Staff was very nice throughout the entire process.
Interview Questions: Name a time where I had a difficult patient and how I overcame it.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Spartanburg Regional Healthcare System in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward interview. Definitely expect situational questions such as the one I listed below.  Just practice ahead of time and use real life experiences. It doesn't necessarily need to be from a healthcare job. I was also asked where I see myself in five years.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time where you had to work as part of a team, what your role was and how you helped, and what was the outcome?

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Spartanburg Regional Healthcare System (Spartanburg, SC) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Included a prescreen by employment and recruitment, then an initial phone interview, then a final, in person interview. After the interview, I heard from employment and recruitment within a week with an offer.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you did not get along with a coworker, and how you handled the issue.

title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Spartanburg Regional Healthcare System in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back. Not formal. Asked the regular questions that you would assume that most places would ask. Friendly people and employees. I would suggest that you look up the information prior to the interview before you go.
Interview Questions: What is your experience in this role?

title: Inpatient Epic Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Spartanburg Regional Healthcare System in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I arrived to the site and the recruiter arrived to meet me. We were early. Later someone escorted us to a conference room. Two women sat across from me panel style, a few feet away to my left was the hiring manager/supervisor. The interview from my dreaded viewpoint, you know the mindset, "I answered that well," That was a winner," "Nailed that answer..." The cordiality and professionalism were natural. The common accents of Southern hospitality filled the air. So chummy I eventually rose from my seat and opened the door for the two women about to exit the space...it was earnest and natural for me. The manager during the interview mentioned she was surprised another hospital did not give me a job. Lol... That is funny because I was later surprised, she did not either. [Is it ok to pull out the race-card in South Carolina, even when the person has the same complexion as you, Caribbean/Panama accent? Sure it's ok, it's South Carolina and many a professional person has left the state for the metropolitan regions of Atlanta and Charlotte. I have lived here for nearly 16 years but never within my high-profile profession. The business culture that day was apparent - no room for inclusion or demographic diversity beyond a broom or mop outside of the clinical area. I never saw that part. My interview was for a non-clinical position. The hallways appeared to have only peoples' cousins, nephews, fathers, and mothers...everyone related somehow by blood or spirit.
Interview Questions: Have you tried to interview elsewhere?

title: Accounting Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Spartanburg Regional Healthcare System (Spartanburg, SC) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: Group interview setting that included the hiring manager, peer and manager’s manager. The in-person  interview went well with no lapses during conversation. I left feeling optimistic and was told I’d hear back within a few days.  After a few weeks, and my continued follow up with the HR recruiter, I was told they hired someone else. No explanation or rationale of hiring decision was provided.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a challenging situation you’ve overcome in your current role.

title: Caregiver/Companion Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Spartanburg Regional Healthcare System (Spartanburg, SC) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was offered an interview within a day or two. I met them the next day and the interview lasted 30 minutes or less. They were prompt, on time, professional, nice, informative, and they really knew what they were doing. They hit all of the information points well and I left really understanding the job and everything a lot better. They really care about the type of people they're employing and I think that's most important for this type of job.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you've have a difficult situation with a customer/patient and describe how you dealt with it.

title: Patient Access Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Spartanburg Regional Healthcare System
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a  long process but the interview was like any other interview.  The interviewer was very nice and was very interested in what I had to say.
Interview Questions: How do you handle troublesome co-workers?

title: Hospital Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Spartanburg Regional Healthcare System (Spartanburg, SC) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Told me about the job and what I would be doing, and the start date. Also told me about the uniforms and what colors we could wear and not wear.
Interview Questions: Asked me about myself and who I was

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Spartanburg Regional Healthcare System (Spartanburg, SC) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: The environment was relaxed and the interviewers extremely friendly. Asked a few situational based questions, but none of the "common" interview questions. Lasted about 30 minutes and spent a lot of time explaining how things worked on the floor
Interview Questions: What floor would your most recent supervisor recommend you for

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Spartanburg Regional Healthcare System in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted for an interview and after several attempts to meet with the manager I was informed that someone else was offered the position.i made several attempts to be available for the interview and was not replied back.   I was very disappointed.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Monitor Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Spartanburg Regional Healthcare System (Spartanburg, SC) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: they reviewed my resume and had a short phone interview. They then called me in for a board interview with all the managers of the flood. They did a great job getting back to me on time
Interview Questions: How do you handle multitasking

title: Administrative Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Spartanburg Regional Healthcare System
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received an interview, then heard nothing.  After a few months was asked to come back in for another interview.  Now two months following the second interview I have yet again heard nothing.  I found out another co-worker also applied for this position and they have not heard back from them either.  Was told we would get an e-mail one way or the other.
Interview Questions: How would your past experience benefit this position?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Spartanburg Regional Healthcare System (Spartanburg, SC) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was very thoroughly interviewed! The two colleagues brought up the right questions about my studio business and social media experience. Based on what they do in Marketing at Spartanburg Regional, social media can present a competitive platform to secure business. One interviewer ended up becoming my intern supervisor. Both individuals were quite professional and it was a good experience.
Interview Questions: What is my 10-year plan?

title: Patient Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Spartanburg Regional Healthcare System
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and about a week later received a phone call to come in for an interview. The interview was in front of two of the managers there. It mostly consisted of behavior type questions.
Interview Questions: None really, they were all situation type questions that I'd heard before.

title: Senior Coder Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Spartanburg Regional Healthcare System (Spartanburg, SC) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview with manager and then with the team. Round table interview each person took turns asking questions. Pretty laid back with somewhat random questions. Overall a pretty good experience. Most of the staff is wonderful.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths

title: RN - Emergency Room Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Spartanburg Regional Healthcare System (Spartanburg, SC) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly simple and the staff were extremely friendly! I was asked open ended situational questions throughout the entire interview. The interviewed was lead by the nurse manager and both the assistant nurse managers for both night and day shift.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a patient who is non-complaint and not willing to cooperate in his/her plan of care? How would you manage this specific patient?

title: Referral Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Spartanburg Regional Healthcare System
Interview Descriptions: Very fast interview
Interview Questions: No real difficult questions

title: Registered Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Spartanburg Regional Healthcare System
Interview Descriptions: A phone interview, then an in person interview. Small department, so not a lot of people asking questions.
Interview Questions: How would you handle an abusive (either physically or verbally) patient?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Spartanburg Regional Healthcare System (Spartanburg, SC) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was good. Interviewed with managers outside of the area I would be working in.  They used behavioral based interview questions which involved describing a situation and explaining what I did and what the outcome was.  If you know what to expect, these questions aren't hard but for someone who has not interviewed this way or doesn't think fast in the moment, it's good to prepare several situations in advance to help to answer these questions.
Interview Questions: Was I willing to work with others who may be narrow minded?

title: Unit Sec Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Spartanburg Regional Healthcare System (Knoxville, TN) in Aug 2008
Interview Descriptions: phone communication first--hr department 2 times-- went back for test and test--people not friendly
Interview Questions: grade point ave.--too old to remember
